titlestmt.subtitle: A description of the collection at Syracuse University
titlestmt.author: MRC

list.item: 2 October 2020 - rehoused, inventory and biographical history updated (ZEC)

did.head: Overview of the Collection
did.abstract: Collection consists of business records, correspondence, financial material, and legal records.

bioghist.head: Biographical History
bioghist.p: Augustine Washington (1694-1743) was a Virginia planter and the father of George Washington (the first president of the United States) . He had a total of ten children by two wives. His son Augustine II (1720-1762) had six children, one of which was William Augustine (1757-1810). William Augustine had nine children by two of his three wives. One of his children, Sarah Tayloe Washington (1800-1886) married a Lawrence Washington (1791-1875), whose relationship to William Augustine's family is unknown. Lawrence is featured prominently in the collection, as is his and Sarah's son Henry Augustine (H.A.) Washington (1820-1858). Several other Washingtons appear frequently in the collection, such as Richard and Robert, however it is uncertain where they fall (if at all) in Augustine Washington's lineage.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents of the Collection
scopecontent.p: The Washington Family Papers contain business records, correspondence, miscellaneous financial materials, legal records, and subject files relating to several members of the Washington family.
Business records consist of general records, invoices, receipts, and miscellaneous items.
Correspondence consists of letters sent to members of the Washington family, as well as individual members' outgoing correspondence (for example, Lawrence Washington).
Financial materials consist of vouchers, checks, and receipts.
Legal records consist of an administrator's bond, deeds/deeds of sale, and miscellaneous items.
Subject files include State Department documentation, an account from Washington Irving, correspondence regarding the Freemasons from 1925, and a photograph of Henry Clay Hines.
Most of the collection spans the 1800s, with a few exceptions from the late 1700s and the 1920s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: Material is arranged in alphabetical order.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The majority of our archival and manuscript collections are housed offsite and require advanced notice for retrieval. Researchers are encouraged to contact us in advance concerning the collection material they wish to access for their research.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Written permission must be obtained from SCRC and all relevant rights holders before publishing quotations, excerpts or images from any materials in this collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Preferred citation for this material is as follows:

did.abstract: a document addressing Washington Irving's account of a Washington's religious activities
correspondence involving debates about President George Washington's alleged loyalty to the Freemasons
a photograph of Henry Clay Hines and George Washington's check
